div.l: The Coke of London while þe Reve spake
For ioy hym thouȝte he clawed hȳm on the bak
A ha quoth he for crystes passyon̄
This myller hath a scharp conclusyon̄
Vpon̄ his argument of herbygage
Well seyd Salamon̄ in his langage
Ne brynge not eủery man̄ in to thi house
For herboryng by nyȝte is ꝑperylouse
Well ought a man̄ avysed for to be
Whom̄ that he brought in to his pⁱriuete
I prey to god so gyffe me sorow ⁊and care
Yff euer sythen̄ y hight hogge of ware
Herd y myller bett̉er sette a werke
He had a iape of malyce in the derke
And therfor͗e yf ye vouchesafe to her͗e
But god forbede that we stynte her͗e
A tale of me that am a pore man̄
Y woll yow tell as well as I kan̄
A lytull Iape that felle in oure cyte
Our͗e oste answered and seid y gᵃraunt it the
Now tell on Roger loke that it be goode
For many a pastey hast þᵘou lete blood
And many a Iakke of doủer hast þᵘou sold
That hath twyes ben̄ hote and twyes colde
Of many a pylgrym̄ hast þᵘou crystꝭes curse
For of thi ꝑpersely yet fare they þe worse
That they have eten̄ wᵗith þe stubbel gose
For in thi schop̄ goth many a flye lose
Now tell on gentel Roger by thi name
But yette y pᵃray the be not wroth for game
And therwith all he lowh and made gode cher͗e
And seid his tale as ye schull after here ·/
